    • Method Detail

      • giveItems

        public static void giveItems(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
             org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack[] items)
        Give a player all items. Items that were not added to the inventory will be dropped at their feet.
        Parameters:
        player - The player to give the items to.
        items - The items to give to the player.

      • round

        public static double round(double d,
           int decimals)
        Round a number to the given number of decimals.
        Parameters:
        d - The number.
        decimals - The number of decimals to round to.
        Returns:
        The rounded number.

      • logisticFunction

        public static double logisticFunction(double max,
                      double steepness,
                      double x,
                      double x0)
        Calculate the logistic function value.
        Parameters:
        max - Max value.
        steepness - Steepness.
        x - Value to calculate the function value for.
        x0 - Midpoint of function.
        Returns:
        The logistic function value.

      • prepareDescription

        public static java.lang.String[] prepareDescription(java.lang.String message,
                                    java.lang.Object... replacementsArray)
        Prepare a message string for item stack descriptions.
        Parameters:
        message - The message string key (without the "messages." prefix) to use.
        replacementsArray - An array of consecutive {String, Object} pairs, e.g. {"%value", 2.06}.
        Returns:
        The prepared message string for item stack descriptions.

      • prepareMessage

        public static java.lang.String prepareMessage(java.lang.String message,
                              java.lang.Object... replacementsArray)
        Prepare a message string for outputting.
        Parameters:
        message - The message string key (without the "messages." prefix) to use.
        replacementsArray - An array of consecutive {String, Object} pairs, e.g. {"%value", 2.06}.
        Returns:
        The prepared message string.
